Class LatticePanel

OneDimensionalLatticePanel, TwoDimensionalLatticePanel
public abstract class LatticePanel
extends javax.swing.JPanel

Base class for all CA graphics.

David Bahr

Constructor Detail

LatticePanel

public LatticePanel(java.util.Properties properties)
Create a panel for displaying the graphics.

Parameters:
properties - The CA properties.
Method Detail

draw

public abstract void draw(java.awt.Graphics g)
Draws the actual CA graphics. Called by paintComponent to draw this on the screen, and called by a PrinterJob to draw this on a printed page. Usually contains calls to a graphics2D object, such as g2.drawRect(...). Or may contain a call to display a buffered offscreen image, like the offscreen image usually drawn in the method draw(lattice). This method should not be called directly; it is called by the paintComponent() method in this class.

draw

public abstract void draw(java.awt.Graphics g,
                          int upperLeftX,
                          int upperLeftY,
                          int width,
                          int length)
Adds a picture to the panel, put only the specified sub-picture.

This method is currently called for printing purposes.

Parameters:
upperLeftX - The upper-left x-position of the rectangle that will be drawn.
upperLeftY - The upper-left y-position of the rectangle that will be drawn.
width - The width the rectangle that will be drawn.
length - The length the rectangle that will be drawn.

drawLattice

public abstract void drawLattice(Lattice lattice)
Draws the cells of the lattice onto an offscreen image. Does not actually draw them onto the component, only the offscreen image.

The body of this method may be empty if there is no offscreen graphics.

Parameters:
lattice - The CA lattice.

drawCell

public abstract void drawCell(Cell cell,
                              int xPos,
                              int yPos)
Draws the single given cell onto an offscreen image. Draws the cell at the specified position. Note, that this does not actually draw the cell onto the component, but just onto an offscreen image.

The body of this method may be empty if there is no offscreen graphics.

Parameters:
cell - The CA lattice.
xPos - The horizontal coordinate in the graphics space (in pixels) which will be converted into a lattice position where the cell will be drawn.
yPos - The vertical coordinate in the graphics space (in pixels) which will be converted into a lattice position where the cell will be drawn.

getCellUnderCursor

public abstract Cell getCellUnderCursor(int xPos,
                                        int yPos)
Return the cell displayed at the current cursor position xPos and yPos. This method is useful, for example, when we want to change the appearance or content of cells (with a mouse listener). This method is currently used to draw on the lattice.

Parameters:
xPos - The horizontal coordinate of the mouse.
yPos - The vertical coordinate of the mouse.
Returns:
The cell displayed at the position xPos, yPos on the graphics. May be null if there is no cell under the cursor.

getGenerationUnderCursor

public abstract int getGenerationUnderCursor(int xPos,
                                             int yPos)
Return the generation of the cell displayed at the current cursor position xPos and yPos. This method is useful, for example, in one-dimensional simulations where the user may be drawing on a previous generation rather than the current generation. Most applications will return the current generation.

Parameters:
xPos - The horizontal coordinate of the mouse.
yPos - The vertical coordinate of the mouse.
Returns:
The generation of the cell displayed at the position xPos, yPos on the graphics. May be -1 if there is no cell under the cursor.

paintComponent

public void paintComponent(java.awt.Graphics g)
Adds a picture to the panel.

This method is automatically called whenever the window is resized or otherwise altered. You can force it to be called by using the repaint method of the encompassing JFrame or JComponent. Never call this method directly (or the Graphics object may not be specified properly).

Overrides:
paintComponent in class javax.swing.JComponent

getProperties

public java.util.Properties getProperties()
Gets the CA properties.

Returns:
The CA properties.

getToolTipText

public java.lang.String getToolTipText(java.awt.event.MouseEvent e)
Overrides the getToolTip from JComponent so that the tool tip depends on the currently selected simulation.

Overrides:
getToolTipText in class javax.swing.JComponent
Returns:
The tool tip.

getDisplayHeight

public int getDisplayHeight()
Get the height of the display on the panel.

Returns:
The height in pixels.

getDisplayWidth

public int getDisplayWidth()
Get the width of the display on the panel.

Returns:
The width in pixels.

redraw

public abstract void redraw()
Redraws the lattice. Typically, just a call to drawLattice() along with resetting the color of the background.

resizePanel

public void resizePanel(double factor)
Change the size of the display panel by a constant scaling factor.

Parameters:
factor - The scaling factor.

setGridVisible

public void setGridVisible(boolean visible)
Draws a grid mesh on the graphics.

Parameters:
visible - Draws the grid when true, and hides the grid when false.

update

public void update()
Updates the cellular automaton graphics by repainting. This will capture any changes to the graphics.
